author: fitzsimmons

section.chapterTitle: Coheed and Cambria perform Mother Superior inside a shoe repair shop.
section.body:
I've never been much for Star Wars. I saw The Phantom Menace and Jar Jar Binks and never felt strongly of either. I never once thought about harassing a child actor until they gave up on their dreams. What fulfills my inner infant is Coheed and Cambria and if you feel otherwise I will harass your first born into the second-coming of Kafka.

They are a blend of Prog Rock, English Folk and Power Pop. They are often compared to Rush. Rush rocks. I don't take pride in their libertarianism or an association with basement dwellers, but I have dwelled, and I love Sci-fi concepts.

Coheed is my Star Wars.

section.chapterTitle: A Favor House Atlantic - Vitamin String Quartet Tribute to Coheed and Cambria
section.body: Going down the rabbit hole of invasive, technocratic targeting, I was delivered a circus from god Google. It's pretty great. I'm a sucker for all things strings so here enters Vitamin String Quartet, "A classical crossover force in contemporary music."
section.summary: I'm a sucker for all things strings.

description: I came across a video that helped ease my cynicism and combated my disdain for nostalgia.
title: I love Coheed and Cambria and I don't care who knows.
